companies.current_policy: Role-dependent hybrid/remote model - Professional/corporate roles offer remote or hybrid options throughout the US and Canada, while field-based retail and merchandising positions require in-person work

policy_details.office_requirements: Professional roles: Remote or hybrid options available. Field roles (merchandisers, event specialists): 100% in-person at retail locations
policy_details.flexibility: High flexibility for corporate/professional positions with part-time, flexible schedule, hybrid remote, and 100% remote options. No flexibility for field positions due to nature of work

companies.key_findings: Advantage Solutions maintains a differentiated approach based on role type. Corporate/professional positions have access to remote and hybrid work arrangements with considerable flexibility, while field-based positions (merchandisers, event specialists) require in-person work at retail store locations. No evidence of recent RTO mandate or policy tightening for 2024-2025.

companies.current_policy: Limited hybrid options available for eligible positions, with infrastructure supporting remote access for team members. Policy specifics not publicly disclosed

policy_details.office_requirements: Varies by role and department. Clinical positions require in-person presence. Some administrative roles offer hybrid arrangements
policy_details.flexibility: Moderate - Company supports workplace flexibility through full-time, part-time, occasional, alternative schedule, and flexible schedule employment opportunities

companies.key_findings: Atlantic Health System, headquartered in Morristown, NJ, employs 18,000+ people across their healthcare network. Employee reviews mention 'hybrid work' availability, and the organization has infrastructure for secure remote access. However, as a healthcare provider, many clinical roles inherently require in-person work. The company has been recognized as one of Fortune's '100 Best Companies to Work For' for 14 consecutive years. No specific RTO policy changes announced for 2024-2025.

companies.current_policy: Hybrid model called 'Flex@Allegro' - Requires minimum 2 days per week in office for hybrid roles, with managers and teams empowering to decide where and when work will be done

policy_details.office_requirements: Minimum 2 days per week in office for hybrid positions. Employees must reside in states where Allegro has office locations (NH, MA, TX, MI)
policy_details.flexibility: Moderate - Managers and team members collaborate to decide specific work arrangements within the framework

companies.key_findings: Allegro MicroSystems, a semiconductor company headquartered in Manchester, NH, has implemented a structured hybrid work program called 'Flex@Allegro'. The policy requires a minimum of 2 days per week in-office for hybrid roles, with flexibility for managers and teams to determine specific arrangements. Employees appreciate the hybrid workplace model. Geographic restriction applies - remote/hybrid workers must reside in states with Allegro office locations. No indication of recent policy changes or tightening for 2024-2025.

companies.current_policy: Primarily in-office culture at corporate headquarters in Calabasas, CA, with limited remote work capabilities. Some remote positions exist for specific roles

policy_details.office_requirements: Corporate office employees expected on-site. Business attire required. Network infrastructure described as having 'limited capabilities for remote work'
policy_details.flexibility: Low - Primarily in-office expectations with some exceptions for specific remote roles such as recruiters who travel to corporate center as needed

companies.key_findings: The Cheesecake Factory's corporate support center in Calabasas, CA maintains a predominantly in-office culture. Employee reviews from Glassdoor mention 'extremely slow network with limited capabilities for remote work' and business attire requirements, suggesting an office-first environment. While some remote positions exist (e.g., Restaurant Management Recruiter), the overall corporate culture appears to favor in-person work. Company rated 3.7/5 on Glassdoor by 6,200+ employees. No evidence of formal RTO mandate changes for 2024-2025.

companies.current_policy: Fully remote, work-from-home environment for University of Phoenix employees (Apollo Education Group's main subsidiary)

policy_details.office_requirements: None - employees work from home across the United States
policy_details.flexibility: Very high - fully remote model allows employees to work from anywhere in the US, supporting work-life balance and attracting talent nationwide

companies.key_findings: Apollo Education Group (now operating as Phoenix Education Partners following October 2025 IPO) owns University of Phoenix and maintains a fully remote work environment for employees. The organization explicitly states commitment to remote work to 'attract top talent from around the country' while promoting work-life balance and reducing environmental impact. Company went public on NYSE in October 2025 (ticker: PXED) with $1.3B+ valuation. No indication of shifting away from remote-first model. Note: Apollo Education Group is distinct from Apollo Global Management (the investment firm).
